FuncDef:
The binding-pw-up trigger unblock-delay command sets a hold-off time for unblocking service VSI PWs after the protocol VSI PWs bound to an L2VPN monitoring group go Up.
The undo binding-pw-up trigger unblock-delay command restores the default hold-off time for unblocking service VSI PWs after the protocol VSI PWs bound to an L2VPN monitoring group go Up.
By default, service VSI PWs will be unblocked in 2s after the protocol VSI PWs bound to an L2VPN monitoring group go Up.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a hold-off time for unblocking service VSI PWs.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 60, in seconds. The default value is 2s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After an L2VPN monitoring group is created and bound to protocol VSI PWs, you need to run the binding-pw-up trigger unblock-delay command to set a hold-off time for unblocking service VSI PWs after the protocol VSI PWs go Up.
Precautions
If the binding-pw-up trigger unblock-delay command is run after a hold-off timer is started, the newly configured hold-off timer is used.
